etymology.description: 皇 (august; imperial) + 帝 (supreme ruler; deity) = emperor/sovereign
etymology.interpretation: Title adopted by Qin rulers to elevate status above kings, combining an 'august' quality with the idea of a supreme ruler. Later became the standard term for the monarch in dynastic China and influenced neighboring cultures.

examples.chinese: 秦始皇自称皇帝(秦始皇自稱皇帝)。
examples.english: Qin Shi Huang styled himself as emperor.

examples.chinese: 皇帝颁布了新的法令(皇帝頒布了新的法令)。
examples.pinyin: Huángdì bānbù le xīn de fǎlìng.

examples.chinese: 在古代，中国由皇帝统治国家(在古代，中國由皇帝統治國家)。
examples.pinyin: Zài gǔdài, Zhōngguó yóu huángdì tǒngzhì guójiā.
examples.english: In ancient times, China was ruled by an emperor.
